Use university pedagogy: Bloom's Taxonomy (REMEMBER to CREATE), active learning, scaffolding. **Research Context (Complete & Grounded):** Private Package Registry Security focuses on securing internal package storage (e.g., like npm/PyPI but private). Core concepts: Package registry (stores/distributes packages), software supply chain (dev-build-distribute process), adversaries (inject malware), provenance (artifact history), SBOM (component inventory). Standards: SLSA (levels for build/source security; Build Track: secure builds/provenance; Source Track: tamper-resistant source); OpenSSF OSPS Baseline (best practices: RBAC access controls, vulnerability scanning, package signing w/ Sigstore, immutability, replication protection). Best practices: Auth (tokens), scanning (e.g., Trivy), signing (cosign), SBOM integration. (exactly 3)]}. Vary bloom_level evenly across 6 levels. Balance across 4 layers. Questions: Mix MCQ (with distractors as options), short answer, scenario-based. Output as JSON array of objects.
